Horribly disparaging comments spew from professor cameron when you turn in perfectly decent papers... she almost convinced me to quit my major...
She's a good lecturer, but she can be very mean and doesn't have patience with most students. Don't take courses with her as an undergrad.

Dr. Campbell is a caring and knowledgeable professor in the field. He remembers all of our names. He is really a nice grader and his exams are not hard if you take notes and pay attention in classes. The group project and field trip are also fun. Would love to take his classes again in the future.

Dr. Campbell is a caring and knowledgeable professor in the field. He remembers all of our names. He is really a nice grader and his exams are not hard if you take notes and pay attention in classes. The group project and field trip are also fun. Would love to take his classes again in the future.
No greater feeling than trying to find external resources just to see that it says the topic is Calc III every week
She gives a lot of work but it's nothing too difficult . You can often find the solutions online just by googling them, she just finds them from textbooks and other professor's worksheets.

This guy is a horrible teacher, just wants his students thinking like he does, not much open for discussion. I enjoyed the readings, but lectures were long and rambling without ever reaching a point. Responses to questions were the same. I was really excited for this class, especially because of my German heritage, but it was a huge disappointment.
Professor Carpenter clearly loves poetry and loves teaching. He really inspired me to go on and pursue poetry. His feedback is incredibly detailed. Great guy
Great guy, really wacky assignments. You will LOVE IT!!!!
This man is a genius, best brain surgeon to ever live. Should've been our president, but HUD will do.
Okay teacher but I LOVE neurology
No Comments

Professor Castello is a challenging professor and taught the material quite well. Her lecture is extremely dense and requires razor sharp attention the whole time to understand what was going on. Missing a couple minutes could lead to the student being completely lost. She doesn't curve which is sad, but that doesn't mean she is a bad teacher.

I just have to say, if you plan on taking this class god speed. I have never taken a class this rigorous in my life. Being honest, if you have a job or a family you really don't stand a chance, because the amount of work required to do semi-well is beyond what any normal human can handle. For 4 months this class ruined my life, and I'm not joking.

Lectures: Verbally clear, but usually no visual aids. Notes copied into Powerpoint. HW: 5 very long, tedious problems, no software allowed unless stated. Discussion: Another homework problem, really? Textbook: Mostly irrelevant and unhelpful. Material: Pretty interesting. Neurodivergents: Beware. She's inflexible, assumes ill intent/dishonesty.

Waste of time and money, the teacher does not explain the course well, she just read her notes. Youtube is much better explaining the course material. long exams, very very long homework. If you want to fail take this class.
Her lectures  building a small ship Her homework  building a cruiser Her exam  building an aircraft-carrier And also, no solution provided for exams & homework Really irresponsible lecturer!
Not sure why she gets such a bad reputation from students. Shes a good lecturer and makes the class interesting.

Professor Castello is a challenging professor and taught the material quite well. Her lecture is extremely dense and requires razor sharp attention the whole time to understand what was going on. Missing a couple minutes could lead to the student being completely lost. She doesn't curve which is sad, but that doesn't mean she is a bad teacher.

Textbook is useless. Professor gave very unreasonable amount of homework involving mostly untaught definitions and theorem. Not considerate at all assign mini-assignment that is due 25 minutes after problem post. Apparently, she is not considering students might have class right after her class.

Castello provides good examples of definitions and concepts. She has solid and clear proofs - great for students with no background in proofs. She is sometimes unprepared to answer students' questions, although they are not hard questions. The class is super easy. The exams are easy but time is limited.

Homework is CHAOTIC. Keeps changing it even within 48 hours of the DDL. Very very mean professor. She does not care how students learn. You won't pass her class without any self-study. Don't bother going to the lecture. That's is what "ABSOLUTE USELESS" is for.
She is the MOST mean person I have ever met at Hopkins. She can ONLY read of from her notes and is not capable of elementary algebraic calculation. Her problem set is ambiguous and redundant.

She reads off of her notes and speaks really fast. She gives homework question that relates to next lecture, thats all fine but why grade so harshly. Tuition is $$$, why so mean? YouTube videos (not by her) have been really helpful. She says shes passionate about teaching but she probably need to reassess her abilities.
Not familiar with the course material. Unable to describe problem clearly. Most students are confused by problem set instructions.
Cannot describe problems properly in the problem sets; had to make multiple clarifications for students to understand the problem. Unfamiliar with course material.

Exams were very difficult and not curved. The class at the end of the semester was not curved, unless you were failing. Very difficult class, and the professor made no attempt to help students when it came to their grades.

FINAL GRADES ARE NOT CURVED!! Midterms are not easy and some are impossible to finish with the time given. Lectures are useless because it is straight out of the textbook. But you still need to go to lectures to get those random unfair  bonus points she gives. Homework are long and useless as a study material for midterms and finals.

very nice teacher. lectures are clear and thorough though they can be boring at times. textbook is pretty bad but if you go to lectures you'll be fine. tests are somewhat difficult but not impossible. homework is important; no quizzes. pay attention and the class is fun.
reasonable amount of homework.  tests are not hard because you get to make a cheat sheet.
Easy easy class (math models) but SO MUCH busywork for homework that it makes u want to die.  Not so nice if she doesn't like you.
One of the nicest teachers I've ever met, she really cares about the students learning and doing well. She doesn't trick anyone in her exams, so most people get the grade that they deserve.
Good deal.  Very reasonable.

The most stuck up and disorganized teacher I have ever had in my entire life. I am righting this 19 days after my final and I still haven't gotten my final grade. This course was flat out disorganized, the teacher was never available on the dot when help was needed and he shouted back at us when we requested things, like where are we taking exams.

Relatively not a lot of reading considering it's a writing class. She gives everybody 98% on their writing assignments so easy grading.  The readings are interesting and she definitely cares about the class but you can't count on it as an accurate representation of the writing sems department at Hopkins.
Her class was easy and she's super helpful.  The readings and papers are interesting and fun to write.

She's great. She's a passionate writer and a wonderful mentor. I recommend Intro to Fiction and Nonfiction to anybody looking to learn to write, or to write "more better." I enjoyed a lot of freedom of expression in her class. Kinda sucks that she makes you buy the relatively expensive textbook that she wrote, but whatever, no prof is perfect.
Not very understanding. Strict, hard grader (harder than should be for night school)

Class taken at Georgetown. Very quiet and caring prof. Do the homework fully and participate and you'll do fine. If you are genuinely interested in philosophy and ancient texts take the class, but it's not worth the time if you aren't. Meet with him about the research paper before you start prospectus and he'll offer a unique avenue for research.

Dean Celenza's class was interesting but not extremely engaging. You will have the opportunity of a lifetime to look at old texts, but you will also have to be on top of a heavy workload and participation. I would mainly recommend this class to people who have extensive background knowledge about medieval Christianity.

Class taken at Georgetown. Very quiet and caring prof. Do the homework fully and participate and you'll do fine. If you are genuinely interested in philosophy and ancient texts take the class, but it's not worth the time if you aren't. Meet with him about the research paper before you start prospectus and he'll offer a unique avenue for research.

I found the course not difficult and Cervone very affable. She even moved a paper deadline back a week when we asked her and she allowed people to retake parts the exam they missed. The lectures can get boring or repetitive but overall nice professor nice class.

This class was the worst experience. Everyone around me would agree. People are doodling in their notebooks because her lectures end up no where. She lectures from her head and it starts making no sense after 30 minutes in. It is truly a grueling class to sit through. Her lectures are not helpful and everyone ended up failing the tests.

This class was ridiculous. She would go on and on, it's mind numbing. Unless you wanna feel every single minute of her 1.15 hour class, don't take it. No visual material, all from her head... more then half the class almost failed her midterm. The reading--a joke because she hops from topic to topic. I'd avoid her if possible. Discussion mandatory.

He is really smart and funny and lectures much better than the older professor. I don't know why he didn't teach more since his notes made the material more accessible than the primary readings. For our sections, he assigned 25+ pages of homework each night. I had time to read but it was definitely hard.
Excellent professor. Very motivating Great videos for the online classes
Excellent professor. Very motivating Great videos for the online classes
The homework is very difficult assigned reading is far more than the video overviews Prof need to add way more videos to explain the subject and the scope of the reading

I liked the course structure and Mr. Chambers was quick to reply to questions. Class ramps up in difficulty too, so plan to increase your effort starting in mod4. Final was much more difficult than the prior 7 modules. Seems to be the norm at JHU as surveys are in mod7, and profs want a strong rating. Overall, I thought it was a good course.

I did not enjoy Professor Chambers. He is not a bad guy. He is very thin skinned and did not like dissension. I think many students do well with him, so this isn't a warning to avoid him. He is very picky on homework. The exam is a bear.

Dr Chavez is a great professor and explains the material very thoroughly. He definitely expects you to remember your organic synthesis reactions, so have your organic chem book accessible! His powerpoints are great, but you'll definitely still need to read the chapters. He's a tough grader, so make sure you pay attention to every detail.

Dr Chavez is a great professor and explains the material very thoroughly. He definitely expects you to remember your organic synthesis reactions, so have your organic chem book accessible! His powerpoints are great, but you'll definitely still need to read the chapters. He's a tough grader, so make sure you pay attention to every detail.

Dr Chavez delivers the materials comprehensively, and is well-prepared to teach his students. He approaches biochemistry with a background in organics, so it allows you to better understand reaction mechanisms, enzyme kinetics, and biochemical processes. I find the lectures to be lucid, and readily-absorbable.
Learned something new
Politics of South Asia was literally the best class I have ever taken.  A lot of reading but so interesting.  Absolutely fantastic, amazing teacher.
I agree with last reviewer. Prof. C.L. Chien does not teach the physics lab. He is a professor spending a lot of efforts on students.

Other reviewers who reference him as teaching physics lab have the wrong professor.  There are two Chiens in the dept., CL Chien and CY Chien.  CY taught the lab.  The class I had with CL was very interesting.  He explained not only the physics, but also took some time to talk about the people who made the discoveries. Definitely a great professor!
I gained nothing in the long run from this class
Whole lot of arbitrary grading. Expectations not defined at all.
Worst classes at Hopkins (none of TAs speak English and youre only graded on Statistical Analysis--and no, not the easy one), avoid like the plague.
Professor Childers is the best teacher I have ever had! He really knows a lot--everyone should meet Prof Childers!

Professor Chirinos is a wonderful teacher. She explains things clearly and is straightforward, which is helpful in a language class. She is very kind and willing to help/clarify. She is a fair grader and her classes are very engaging. She cares about her students and genuinely wants them to do well. Focus and work hard and you'll succeed.

Professor Chirinos is a wonderful teacher. She explains things clearly and is straightforward, which is helpful in a language class. She is very kind and willing to help/clarify. She is a fair grader and her classes are very engaging. She cares about her students and genuinely wants them to do well. Focus and work hard and you'll succeed.

He's a really nice guy, but he tends to rush through lectures, and his explanations are not perfect due to the language barrier.  Use notes/lectures/HW problems to study.  Make sure you know every example he's done in class or else the exam will surprise you.  Unless it's an honors class he tends to only throw one proofy/theory question on exams.
chu's great.
Very helpful.  Willing to help you out during his office hour.  Very passionate in teaching.  His accent may cause some problems though.

Warning: small but funny accent. he's the most enthusiastic teacher here. Lectures move fast but are spent doing examples and he's greatly focused on trying to foster an understanding of the material. Homework is a lot if you wait til the night before, but great class, reasonable tests, great guy. don't take calc from anyone else if possible.
Funny professor with a good sense of fashion- love his argyle sweaters. Extremely patient and gets through lecture fast. Tests are based on reviews, so they are pretty easy. He made calculus 3 fun.
Prof Chung is great. Very helpful and accessible. Reading is long but manageable. Her grading is fair.
Prof Chung is great. Very helpful and accessible. Reading is long but manageable. Her grading is fair.

Super passionate teacher; clearly very knowledgeable about her topic of study. Took her class as a freshman and even though I was obviously  lagging behind my sectionmates, she was super encouraging and never dismissed my views!  Learnt alot.
Very clear lecture--organized, engaging, and relevant.

She doesn't seem to know anything besides Korean immigrants in Japan. In our East Asian Politics class, she just made us read papers and barely taught. For the China part, we had to watch a three day movie because she didn't know anything. Unhelpful and unresponsive to e-mails. Loves her Korean heritage and often is ... extremely biased.

She makes you read the articles then memorize their key points. If you do not memorize the author's names, there was no point in taking any test. The problem wouldn't be so bad if there weren't 200+ pages a week to read. I made a final review sheet which was more than 60 pages long (front/back font: 10). Not an effective class. Do not take it.
She has a nice personality and has some good class discussions, but her lectures aren't very helpful for the difficult exams.

Very mean. Teaches nothing. Gives no specific instructions before students' presentations but does criticize a lot after. Has an extra pre than others professors. Does not extend the deadline of essay while half class is taking CFA exam though other professors do. Have extra work( weekly post) than others.
Had Gail for Effective Teams and loved her!
Great instructor.  She keeps you the full 4.25 hours each class but she makes learning fun and the time goes by quick.  I really learned a lot.

MC is a legend! She is an incredible educator who teaches leadership extremely well, and she's caring, hilarious and inspirational. She deeply cares about each of her students and their success and growth. Every class is highly engaging and I learned so much while having her as a professor. 11/10 recommend!

MC is a legend! She is an incredible educator who teaches leadership extremely well, and she's caring, hilarious and inspirational. She deeply cares about each of her students and their success and growth. Every class is highly engaging and I learned so much while having her as a professor. 11/10 recommend!

Clay (he asks us to call him by his first name!) is an absolute joy to be around. His class is easily my favorite. He doesn't hold anything back, which is extremely refreshing. He seems to genuinely care about his students, too. He's made me such a better writer, and a much more contemplative person.

I had Manuel for Conversational Spanish and he made the class very fun. I learned a lot and we had a great atmosphere. He made sure everyone learned. He's still my favorite spanish professor, and he runs JHU in Madrid. He's a funny guy and all the girls thought he was hot. He dresses kinda like a European Mr. Rogers.
Dr. Thomas Colonna is a great professor. I enjoyed his classes and presentations enormousely. I would take them again if I had the choice. One of the best at JHU
Dr. Thomas Colonna is a great professor. I enjoyed his classes and presentations enormousely. I would take them again if I had the choice. One of the best at JHU

Dr. Colonna is a superb professor. His class is a tremendous opportunity for students to learn from an expert in the field, who is extremely talented in teaching the material in a clear and engaging way. In addition, he clearly cares about his class and students, and wants them to succeed. Dr. Colonna is excellent!

No lectures, instead he will do a few chats a semester (optional). He definitely has a sense of humor and he will demonstrate it in his case studies. Case studies do take time as you have to evaluate & assess something ridiculous.  Case studies are way futuristicsci-fi inspired, so even the FDA Center Directors can't help you (yes, I called them)
Super interesting
Super interesting
Great Professor and brilliant thinker

I adore Professor Connolly  probably the best professor I had at Hopkins  and I honestly think that the people who find him "too impressed with himself" don't understand his ideas. On the contrary, I'm continuously amazed by how unassuming he is and just how patient he is with students saying the dumbest stuff in class
He does have an inflated ego but overall Professor Connolly is nice and respectful of the opinions of his students, which is certainly very important.

Connolly's lectures challenge both neo-conservative and neo-liberal points of view. He engages students with a vast array of thinkers, and his class in both interesting and fun. He is very kind and respectful of student's.
Extremely Good Professor. Brilliant Man.

William Connolly is a giant figure in modern political theory, it is truly honor to be in a class with him. He is a very good lecturer and exposes students to new and shocking concepts/ways of thinking. His work on the tragic, immanent naturalism, identity/difference, and secularism is truly ground breaking.
He's incredibly smart and interesting. He's doing work that is truly cutting edge. Anyone who says otherwise, just isn't smart enough themselves to get it!

Smart but outrageously facile. More like journalism than political theory. This is a Johns Hopkins professor?!  And so retro, like MTV.  If he was a horror movie, he'd be "It Came from the 1980s!"  I think he became famous back when political theory was really very limited. Things have changed. He could always review movies for Roger Ebert.
Profoundly insightful and respectful of student thought.
Although sometimes dry, Connolly is intelligent and his lectures are useful for papers and the exam. He's informative and nice in person.
Professor Connolly is brilliant.
This guy has a much higher opinion of his intellect than the evidence warrants.  He really needs to get over himself.  Avoid like the plague.
Grades more harshly than usual. Interesting material that covers breadth well and examines macro-scale topics well but struggles to confer knowledge of minutiae.

Boring lectures, ppl either don't come or fall asleep in class.  The choice of text is horrible, with very few examples.  Great guy though, very approachable.  The TAs don't speak English, but know the craft.
Get  ready to read

I have had this professor for 3 Classes: Negotiation & Mediation, Employment Law, and Constitutional Rights.  If you show up, pay attention, and participate you'll do great!  She has a great sense of humor!
Fairly straightforward class, 50% of test is straight off the HW and the other 50% is from lecture. You never need to even buy the textbook.

Super great guy! He was only my TA but I've also heard great things about the classes that he teaches on his own. He is super interested in the subject and that is very apparent. I will actively try to take courses from him in the future.

He's a nice guy who genuinely wants you to learn. He gets ahead of himself a bit though, and also can be a little contradicting. Other than that, he's a pretty good teacher and definitely knows what he's talking about.
LOVEDDD this class!!  The teacher was also really cool!
ooo, I'm hot for this teacher
super-friendly, quirky guy.  very laidback teaching approach and incredibly patient.

I took Dr. Cummings for Principles of Immunology. The course was very lecture and textbook heavy. It required lots of reading and note taking from his lectures. His quizzes and tests are timed and sometimes quite long, so make sure you review your notes beforehand. He was very nice and responsive when asked for clarification or assistance.
Don't teach much but grade hard.
Heavy reading. High standard. Thorough.

Dr. Cunningham's lectures are engaging and understandable. However, the homework is ridiculously hard and ambiguous. His tests are in a similar fashion, unfortunately. The questions are ambiguous, but the expected answers are so specific it's difficult to fathom how we are expected to reach the exact same conclusion. His office hours are unhelpful.
Dr. C was amazing.  I didn't expect to like Genetics, but he made it all totally relevant and interesting too.  By far one of best professors I've ever had.

Very inspiring lecturer and also very approachable. Has a British-like accent (!) Makes genetics interesting by presenting material to make students think. Exams tests your ability to comprehend, not memorize, so could be hard.
Soo hot. Loved the class. Very funny guy. Glad I took this class with him.
Joe is pretty fresh.  I like how he keeps it soooooo real, and he has cool salt and pepper hair.
joe's better than consani. helpful, but forces you to go beg for points. knows the material. funny

Great teacher, lets you do a lot.  Knows his patients and expects  you to learn them quickly.  Does inpatient and outpatient and always has after hours events (health fairs, working sporting events) or patients.  Day is never over, but you hardly notice the time.
I dreaded a month outside of the hospital.  Wasn't that bad.  Learned some things I can use.
If you want to practice medicine outside of Hopkins this is the guy to show you how.  Has office and hospital patients, doesn't overwork you, but expects you to take EVERY pt seriously-sick or not.

Dr. D'Souza was great. Super clear, patient lectures and a remarkably well-structured class; despite the online format, orgo lab was kind of fun with her. Though it is a sizable amount of work week to week, the work keeps you on top of things and pads your grade; exams are only 33% of your grade.

Dr. D'Souza was great. Super clear, patient lectures and a remarkably well-structured class; despite the online format, orgo lab was kind of fun with her. Though it is a sizable amount of work week to week, the work keeps you on top of things and pads your grade; exams are only 33% of your grade.
Lot of assignments-but they are pretty easy if you just do everything that is required.

Dr. D'Souza is def a nice person, but she and the TAs hurry you a lot during lab and it's kinda hard to actually enjoy the experiments. Exams are complete memorization - doable but sometimes there's no partial credit for like a 20 point question. Her grading criteria for lab reports are very clear so that's a plus.
Rote memorization to succeed on exams, but is very useful for the MCAT!
Had so much fun!

Dr. D'Souza is an amazing person who cares so much about the safety and happiness of her students. Her lab is extremely well structured and makes sure students can learn practice skills and useful information.
Excellent professor overall!

She genuinely cares about her students and really wants everybody to do well. She curves the class to a 90% and often states her grading criteria in handouts and during lectures. Make sure to pay attention to the details on her powerpoint for exams.

She definitely does make you work for it. However, it is a rewarding experience. Grading wise, she's pretty clear in what she expects. Lab reports are very straight forward as she gives you the specific wording to use. Exams are challenging because there are no backtests (the legend is no one has a past exam) and she focuses on details and concepts

Larissa has a degree in editing and is very specific about wording on exams to the point where she subtracts points if you do not copy her words from lecture verbatum. Partial credit does not exist in this class and memorization of useless properties is given undue attention in this course. Morale is always low after doing anything for this class.

Larissa embodies the scientific stereotype here at JHU. She expects perfection and grades assignments on wording rather than subject matter which is a common source of frustration because no one memorizes paragraphs verbatim. Her tests pull arbitrary information from the backlogs of her slideshows. Her TA's are amazing though.

Dagdaddy has been teaching for many years, far too many years. His exams are tough and test you over very miniscule details. You need to know how to take to his tests more than the knowledge itself. It's possible to get an A but get ready to work for it.
tests are tough. you have to read and study a lot and do not skip the details. He is a tough grader
for senior lab/design, she makes you work hard and think through the problems. she's very knowledgeable, but overall a tough grader.

Very monotonous voice, and not engaging at all, but she makes sure that she covers everything that there is to know. If you pay attention (which is very hard to do) and follow everything then its very useful, but reading the textbook for 15 min. can be just as effective. Problems in the textbook are good practice for exams.

540.202- I had her for Intro to Chemical and Biological Process Analysis. She has a french accent and does not speak loudly enough, but was thorough in class if you could understand her, didnt like the textbook much, but the class was easy enough if you keep up with the work.
Changes criteria for group projects the day that the project is due. Additionally, does not read emails thoroughly.

Drew Daniel is one of the most brilliant and interesting professors i've ever had. He's somewhat eccentric and I feel that he's gotten even weirder as the years have passed, but I love his courses anyway. He's one of those people for whom you immediately know you're in presence of something special, and I'd recommend anyone take a course with him.
Prof. Daniel holds high expectations and is a fair grader and interesting lecturer.
Super interesting lectures. Seems like a great guy. Class calls for a lot of reading, but the exams aren't too difficult if you study. I would absolutely recommend this class and this professor!
Very smart and funny. Sometimes too smart.

very good and engaging lecturer, so fun to talk with, always willing to help. must read a shakespearean play a week, so keep up with your reading. his ideas are clear and well-explained. thoroughly enjoyed this class!
No Comments

Loved this class. Dr. Satarupa Das is so good at teaching. She provided .ppt's (with her own narration + copies of the .ppts with separate text transcripts), many websites with videos and interactive info, answered my questions quickly/thoroughly, was organized, prepared, and stayed on topic. Wish I could clone her for all my classes.

Loved this class. Dr. Satarupa Das is so good at teaching. She provided .ppt's (with her own narration + copies of the .ppts with separate text transcripts), many websites with videos and interactive info, answered my questions quickly/thoroughly, was organized, prepared, and stayed on topic. Wish I could clone her for all my classes.

Really solid choice for Biochem. Very straight forward class and very manageable work load. Expects weekly discussion participation, but it's difficult to achieve. Lectures cover whats expected on HW and exams and no surprises there. Definitely recommend.
The best lecturer I've ever had
The best lecturer I've ever had

It is impossible to overstate how great of a lecturer Prof. David is. He is witty, funny, engaging, and cares a great deal about his students. He does assign a lot reading but they are very interesting and similar to his lectures. 11/10 recommend Prof. David.

Professor David is hilarious and engaging! He records his lectures, so you don't necessarily have to go to every class, but I NEVER missed a single one and looked forward to every class. The readings are long, but very interesting. He really knows his stuff! However, the grading really depends on what TA you have and which TA grades your exam :(
Steven David is one of my favorite professors! Reading is about 150-200 pages a week, but don't be intimidated by that. Besides reading, there is basically no work other than studying for tests.
Best political science professor at JHU. His lectures are thought provoking and always interesting. He honestly cares about his students
Great class. Witty, intelligent. Best class at JHU

This was my favorite class this semester and it is what made me decide to major in international studies. The lectures are clear and entertaining. The lecture hall was full every class because of what a good professor/lecturer Professor David is. I looked forward to this class every week and I recommend it to anyone with an interest in politics

I took contemporary international politics (CIP) and it was by far my best class! Although the readings are dense and at times overwhelming, lecture made everything clear in an interesting and engaging way. Of course, some people don't find it interesting, but if you like history and politics, this class is amazing. He's a great professor.

Took this class 10 years ago, and thought it was one of the most useless classes I took at JHU. I've since taken an IR theory class at the MA level, and what a difference! Everything that I should have learned 10 yrs. ago became crystal clear.

This class was wonderful. Professor David is extremely interesting and very witty and funny. He really knows his stuff. Some of the reading was a bit redundant, but his lectures are what made this class great.

Lectures are told in beautiful stories. He's funny, charming, considerate, approachable. CIP is podcasted but people still show up to class because its fun. Only 3 grades, lectures prepare you for the essays. :))
What a cute, FUNNY, engaging professor!  His lectures are riveting-- I never missed one!  and he's absolutely hilarious. CIP was one of the best classes I've ever taken

He's a really great professor and a great lecturer. It's hard only having 3 grades in the semester and having the TAs grade them, but overall CIP is a great course just because he's so good at making it crystal clear.
Prof Davis was an amazing lecturer who made heavy IR theory both interesting and easy to learn. He is by far one of the best IR profs at Hopkins.
One of the best professors I have met.
Very interesting and intelligent professor who's good at education. His lectures are helpful.
Amazing prof, amazing class.  Very well organized and brilliant.  Made me want to be Poly Sci.  Adorably witty as well.
good

Great lecturer. Material was pretty interesting, but tons tons tons of reading. If you don't like to read, don't take this class. If you want to hear a really smart guy talk about something he knows better than pretty much anyone else....yeah, go for it.
No Comments
Very interesting class, and a good professor. He can be intimidating and sometimes tactless for sensitive people. But then again, maybe sensitive people aren't made to be writers. Loved this class.

Tristan wasn't as querulous as other posters have mentioned. He is insanely intelligent, and probably makes a few comments to amuse himself. He is a teacher who can, if it strikes him, make incredibly profound observations. One of which helped me to rethink a novel I am working on.
Tristan is cool if he likes your writing. He's very easygoing but be forewarned-- don't take his courses unless you have a thick skin. He WILL pick on you at some point in the semester.
Tristan is a ridiculous human being. He does recognize good writing, is not harsh if he encounters bad writing. All in all it's a stress-free class.
Avoid! I went to the extent of switching my major to English.
It's NOT an easy class if he happens to take a dislike to you.

It's an easy enough class, you just have to turn in a few stories and let him insult you (he seems to think he's witty). Then you can sit back and quietly read web pages while he rips other students' stories apart. You won't learn anything, but at least he doesn't make you buy any books. For a few laughs, Google his writing, it's hilariously bad!
No Comments
No Comments

Hilarious, dedicated, honest, encouraging...he's a very gifted teacher if a less celebrated author.  He takes the time to insist that students tackle hard questions about their own work and the work of others.  He's very relaxed and develops a personal relationship with you(essential for a teacher reading your personal creations.)

Mr. Davies specialized in making people feel bad - his class resembled a target practice for pretentious undergrads seeking to up their own egos by taking potshots at one another, while Davies sat back and fueled the flame.  Didn't learn a darn thing 'bout how to write...but an easy grader.

I took this class over the summer, and it was amazing.  He really likes to get to know his students.  His teaching methods are very flexible, and allow for more creativity of the individual writer.  He is a great grader, and he is so funny.  Take any class by this guy!

Good professor and passionate about counseling. Grading can be arbitrary and not objective. Overall learned a lot and worked my butt off to get an A. Definitely a lot harder than other counseling courses but you get some of the best supervision for your recorded sessions.

Intro to Counseling: 861.507. Worked like crazy to end up with an A-. The workload of this class is unrealistic. Three counseling sessions are conducted with a classmate (accompanied by 10 pg papers) and two research papers - takes forever to get back (over a month). Grading is arbitrary. Take if you want to learn. Skip if you care about your GPA.
Great feedback on assignments. Clear deadlines. Requires effort.
Great feedback on assignments. Clear deadlines. Requires effort.

John is a great instructor. Everything you need to know are in his lectures and reading assignments. He responds promptly to questions and gives little hints when you need it. Don't expect an easy A. Everything must be earned. Bad students get bad grades.

Prepare to spend 25+ hours/week on homework. 30 towards end. Assignment due every six days, plus three labor-heavy projects. Assignments are poorly written, and he'll grade you on things not spelled out in the assignments.  Gives feedback often, knows his stuff, but feedback hard to follow. Exams instructions will be poorly written.

Excellent professor. one of a kind. brings experience and research in a fun class. lessons are well structured, gives feedback on every assignement and teaches you how to make your reasearch material add value to your portfolio. In short the best!

The best professor ever. Meaningful classes that will serve you in your professional career, Subject matter expert in change management, KM, Project Management and Strategy and Innovation.  Well organized, fun and lively classes. Inspires you to learn complex systems from a simple easy to understand perspective.
Blends theory and practice well
Convoluted way of teaching.  Very knowledgeable but does not always translate knowledge into student learning.

Prof. Melvin one of the best . He Has his own way in teaching and he is very smart .He ask for an essay every week what you learned in week before . He is Unique PM.I will not miss any class for him .The most Prof I gained experience from him.
Project Management Information system

Prof. Deudney is a fantastic treasure of IR and Poli Sc of JHU. It is an honor to be his student and get A's in his classes. I took his 4 upper classes (POL190.443/480/407/536) and it was absolutely the best academic experience so far in Hopkins. A lot of reading. No exams/quizzes. One paper 50 pages or 2x25, report book in class if you wish.
Professor Deudney is a brilliant mind and a true asset to JHU. His lectures are largely from his book, which is one of the best poli-sci books I've ever read.

Large amount of reading. But Professor explains the reading quite well in class. Painful to make studyguide for each midterms and usually the finished studyguide is like 25 pages. Painful to memorize studyguides. The lecture is interesting. If you study hard, you will get A. But you need to study hard.

I AM IN LOVE WITH HIM! Omg I am a freshman taking international politics and I just love love love him and I am sad that the class is about to be over :( I wish that I would just stay and speak to him more! He's amazing. His class is the only one that I haven't missed. Take him before you leave Hopkins..no matter what your major is!!

Great prof!Really friendly and helpful,stay around after lecture to answer any questions and very patient to explain.You can see wit shine through his eyes when you talk to him~Brilliant man! definitely recommended his classes!

Cannot even begin to describe how amazing, his lectures are beautiful, i nearly cried once, Class section is useless for most part and he fully explains the readings in lecture so you can get away with not doing it. TAKE GOOD NOTES! That's all you need and you've got your A.Did I mention he's got awesome style? I love his matching hat/blazer combo
loved this class. amazing professor. cannot wait to take another of his classes

great professor, lectures were insightful (readings were long but you didn't really have to do them) he clearly and effectively covers a variety of material along with his own views, a great class. He provides a review sheet before every exam with every question, attend the lectures, use your notes to go over the review sheet and you?ll get an A.

Professor Deudney is nothing short of genius. His lectures are always brilliant. Every lecture was crystal clear. The readings are very long but at the same time the readings are as interesting as they come. You will walk away from this class exponentially smarter than when you walked in. Don't even hesitate to take a Deudney class.
Awesome professor! Very clear, easy to understand, and BRILLIANT in his field. Definitely recommended!
good
This class requires heavy reading but Deudney is extremely helpful. (Review sessions before every exam!) He knows his stuff.
An amazing lecturer who is very easy to understand. Tests are fair and very easy for those who know the material. By far one of the best profs at Hopkins.
Great class, interesting and very clear.  Makes you think of things in a different light.

One of the best classes I've taken here. He examines all positive and negative attributes of a theory. His lectures are very clear and he writes down everything important on the board. Even though he sounds a bit like Dick Gerphardt, he speaks clearly in lecture. Pretty funny also.
Deudney is interesting and knows SO much! He personally held review sessions before each of the 3 (NON CUMULATIVE!!) exams. Good class
Professor Deudney is so cool... he looks like a crazy-tall and bald Elvis Costello, and he has an awesome sinister sense of humor.  And he's very, very smart.  Great class.

The man is brilliant. Definitely an up and comer in the field of IR. He takes well-established IR arguments and sheds them like they were nothing. Very lucid. Friendly. Stays after class to continue discussions. Definitely take his classes---any of them. Also has publication forthcoming.
No Comments
Great lecturer
Great Professor! Very engaging and responsive. Understands that students also have full time jobs. Work is very interesting and relevant.
Great professor! Clear and always does his best as a teacher. Perfect amount of work. Don't feel overwhelmed, and certainly not underwhelmed.
Really tough class
Amazing lectures, easy to understand, tough homework.

I had her for Making America: Mastery and Freedom in British Mainland America.  She was easily one of the most approachable and nice professors I've ever had.  She gave a lot of readings, but she was a very good lecturer.  She didn't even need a powerpoint for her lectures to be clear and concise.  Recommended if you don't mind reading and writing.

This professor is such a slow grader. I completed one exam and I am in the midst of taking my second one and she has yet to grade the first one. Very discussion heavy and for little value She is a slow email responder based on if she wants to answer. lecture notes heavy but no real correlation to the actual test. Teach yourself how to read research
Very hard but very interesting course. Professor is very helpful but homework assignments and exams are very hard.
Doesn't really care about students, but at least makes efforts to teach the material. Improvements could be made, but I still respect him as a professor

I had him for transport II . Try your best in his class. The guy simply doesn't care. He lacks a certain professionalism as a professor. His tests were no way near the materials discussed in class. Average in his class would be in mid 40's. His final was multiple choice and he did not even tell us that the format would be this way. He simply sucks.
"The sugar cubes"... Had him when he first taught the class. Now he's teaching Transport II. Oh boy...
No Comments
he is a very sweet man. however he needs to gain some experience as a teacher and maybe next year he'll be better.
he was horrible
Mark don't have the competence to teach ML. Lack basic math sense!

This professor is very unprofessional. He don't understand ML very well. When students pointed out errors from his slides or flaws in his teaching, he didn't take them seriously and many time ignored them. But when students wanted to demand some unmerited credits from assignments or exams, most of the time he tended to just please them!
Really bad. Not verse in topics.Avoid him; take other ML courses in AMS or BME. Those instructors are defintely better!
This professor really cares about his students, and he really wants you to learn his stuffs. Work hard and you will be okay with this course and learn a lot.
It's a great professor with a lot of home work. If you pay a lot of attention on it, you will get good reward.

a waste of time, prof avoids answering anything but the most superficial questions, can't deal with theory or anything formal.  made lots of mistakes in grading and in lecture.  assignment were riddled with errors.  class devolved into "what people do" and abandoned "why they might do it" or anything useful for serious ml students
Tests very vague and confusing. Do not take social psych with him.
Tests are very unfair.

This professor was horrible. Tests very specific to personal anecdotes told in class. Do not test your general understanding of the information but what he wants you to know about his life. DO NOT TAKE ANY CLASS WITH THIS PROFESSOR. you will not get anything near an A.

Dr. Drigotas is a nice man and an ok professor, but his tests are ridiculous! His multiple choice questions cover the most minuscule details of the lecture and his essays are impossible to answer for full credit. There is no clear rubrik which leaves them up to his own subjective (and often overly critical) interpretation. DO ALL EXTRA CREDIT.
You need the backtest answers in order to pass this class. Questions are worded very strangely and his lecture style leaves you confused about what information to study.

Great professor that makes class rather enjoyable. Drigotas consistently relates key terms to his personal experiences as well as specific case studies, which further enhances one's understanding of the material.  However, it is essential to write down every word that he says or else tests will be extremely difficult. No need to buy the textbook.

I took intro to Psych with Drigotas. His lectures where interesting and there was no homework. The tests were all multiple choice, but weirdly worded. Back tests will SAVE you. Not very helpful if you go to him with concerns about your grade. The class was easy if you managed the tests (there are 3 + final).

While he does a good job of teaching the material, the test are very poorly written. There is a line of 10-20 students wanting to ask him questions about the wording of the test, ambiguous options. etc. at all times. The tests are all multiple choice, and the material is fairly simple, but his poor word choice makes the test much harder.

While the material is definitely a cake walk, his exams are just as unclear and wrought with poor phrasing as his lectures are, making them very difficult for those who don't study his old tests. If you do, you're golden.
Great presenter and clear lectures, but terribly when it comes to one-on-one. Tests are all multiple choice and very easy to make mistakes. Tests don't test knowledge of material.

engaging and funny professor. take notes WORD FOR WORD and you will do fine. otherwise, good luck. super funny during lecture but kind of an ass when meeting with him outside of class. overall, a good teacher though, again just be sure to get thorough notes!
No doubt the laziest professor, which is good and bad. You will not get the grade you deserve based on effort. Makes it so that people with connections (back tests) do best.

Very good at explaining concepts, and at doing so in an interesting and entertaining way. Unfortunately, his tests are VERY poorly written. His command of written English grammar is such that merely comprehending his questions is often difficult. At the same time, he peppers them with ambiguous questions that demand rote memrisation of his stories.

Great class...because so many people enrolled he got rid of the writing portion on his exams, making them super easy if you went to class and took good notes. The course should be easy for you if you have a good memory. The material was great and there wasn't really any work outside of exams except for a 2 page paper. Also Experimetrix was GREAT!
very good at explaining concepts with examples

Excellent professor. Lectures are easy to understand and interesting when highlighted with examples. Tests aren't extremely difficult, but can be tricky. I took about 5-6 pages of notes per lecture, so he doesn't give an overload of info. You don't really need to buy the textbook though (he says he uses it, but no question on a test has come from i

almost impossible to do well unless you go to class and listen intently/take good notes. questions on tests can be very ambiguous unless you write down everything and memorize it.. or remember the answer coming out of his mouth: doesn't post lecture notes, book is useless. if you  memorize everything this class is a breeze.
He's a pretty good professor. Lectures are interesting.  If you go to class and listen to him, the class isn't that hard.

Drigotas is a pretty good teacher, and I actually did learn something from his class. He gives very unfair tests with ambiguous questions. One of the best teachers ive had at hopkins, which isn't saying much.
Dr. Drigotas is an awesome teacher.  His psych classes keep me interested and he gives really fun examples.  The class isn't a lot of work, just mainly a lecture and tests. No homework.

I was hesitant to take this course because the rating on the professor was not good, but I am so glad I did! Dr. Duplantier is the sweetest ever! He goes into length to help you understand, and is very helpful with feedback. Assignments and exams are hard, but you learn so much from him because he shows you how to apply concepts, not just memorize!

I was hesitant to take this course because the rating on the professor was not good, but I am so glad I did! Dr. Duplantier is the sweetest ever! He goes into length to help you understand, and is very helpful with feedback. Assignments and exams are hard, but you learn so much from him because he shows you how to apply concepts, not just memorize!

Nice guy and very accessible if you have questions. Gives feedback on every assignment. Not an easy class in the slightest though. Discussion posts take a whole week to answer, the midterm and final were challenging. Not necessarily hard, just A LOT.

He's the replacement for Matt Hall who was apparently a legend. If Matt Hall is available, take his class. If he's not... Dr. D's a boring lecturer & his slides are awful. He isn't good at making clear points. He's nice but isn't super aware of what his students need. His exams can be brutal so focus more on his lectures & review concepts yourself

He is a solid researcher and educator; his course has lots of homework and he enjoys even adding more to it. He is extremely observant and quite. It may make you feel uncomfortable first, but you'll get used to it. If that happened, remember that his best friend and lunch buddy is this adrenaline (cheerful) diplomat character faculty, Dr. Manbachi!
The smartest professor I have ever had. An absolute genius. His teaching is intellectually stimulating

This class was called Spanish Avantgarde. It was amazing. Great material. Such an amazing and astute professor. The class is not easy. You must have a master of the language to write and understand and analyze. It was a great class though. Philosophical and enlightening. Must take class with this professor if youre willing to work!
Amazing professor. One of the best I've ever had in my entire life.
Great class
a lot of work for not much return
I like him very much. He's a great professor. Yet I'm afraid of his classes.. quite difficult

prof is high-effort, high-commitment and the same is expected of students. class unfortunately has an extremely high work-to-benefit ratio, although raw benefit is higher than most classes (certainly than those at JHU).  assignments are 20+ pages and dense.  prof can be hostile, impatient outside of class.  more indoctrination than introduction.
Lectures are pretty good but much workload off class
The topics are sometimes interesting and sometimes not. Similarly, he is sometimes easy to understand and sometimes not. However, it was still a good course with an average workload.
Eisner is awesome!  He knows everythign about what he is teaching and is extremely kind and helpful.  He genuinely wants you to learn.
good
I have a much better understanding of probability and statistics after taking Eisner's NLP class than I got from other courses that have tried to teach those subjets or applications thereof.
No Comments

Data Structures class was very hard and had tons of homework that took hours per week. Lectures were absolutely fabulous.  Made lactures fun and engaged the class.  I learned a ton in class and WANTED to go to lectures.
No Comments
Excellent class.  Great lab.  I particularly enjoyed the field trips and Professor Elbert's breadth of knowledge.

He like many instructors and advisors at JHU are over inflated, pompous, arrogant, don't return emails promptly, he like his predecessor, never returned my emails about my thesis so I missed the opportunity to even do a thesis!  Frankly JHU has no business offering online education with the attitudes of the advisors!!

He is AMAZING! He puts a lot of time and energy into the course and is dedicated to making sure people understand the concepts - even going so far as to providing information on underlying concepts (such a calculus) to make sure no one is left behind. He is an excellent writer and communicator. I wish he taught all of the classes in my program!
Really smart and interesting, but demanding.  He is relaxed and funny, but don't let that fool you.  Do your work.

Elbert is a tough teacher, but very good and very knowledgeable. Go to him if you want to learn and to be challenged. If you are a lazy student, he is NOT the professor for you. Get ready to take notes!

The best professor ever! When we were stressed out, he decided to bake the class some bread. He is so nice. He is also extremely understanding. He teaches really well and when we had alot of work, he was willing to move the date of the exams. He would also show us funny pictures to make the class more interesting :) He is definitely the best.
Not insightful.
great prof, very helpful, easy class
Was always willing to help, cared about whether or not we learned the material.  Really great guy.

Professor Ender is very sweet; she cares a lot about her students and is always willing to help. I would recommend Heart Matters to students who are genuinely interested in the course's topics (the lectures can be quite lengthy, good bit of reading). She is a little disorganized but won't hesitate to further explain instructions if needed.

Professor Ender is very sweet; she cares a lot about her students and is always willing to help. I would recommend Heart Matters to students who are genuinely interested in the course's topics (the lectures can be quite lengthy, good bit of reading). She is a little disorganized but won't hesitate to further explain instructions if needed.
Professor Ender is a wonderful teacher. She is passionate about the subject she teaches and she is passionate about helping her students do the best they possibly can.

Really chill professor, cares if you understands the topics and is reasonable with grading., especially if you are not a strong writer. Writing topics are a bit difficult to understand though, his office hours are very helpful.

This class requires effective time management from students to review notes, read the book, and solve the problem sets. Brendan is passionate about the topics. He supports a lot his students and brings insight from his experience. One of the best courses to take at Johns Hopkins University

This class requires effective time management from students to review notes, read the book, and solve the problem sets. Brendan is passionate about the topics. He supports a lot his students and brings insight from his experience. One of the best courses to take at Johns Hopkins University

Assignments were a nuisance, in the sense that you don't learn much, they leave you frustrated, and they take alot of time. I did well - not bitter student syndrome here, but I just felt like this coulda been so much better. Also, MATLAB. Please stop using MATLAB. And the assignments should be TeXed. And the questions should be less ambiguous.

Good class/professor. She's responsive to questions, and explains concepts well. Class is well organized, you do a problem set and discussion participation weekly, no busywork or task overload. I wanted to see a bit more emphasis on stats in the "real-world" vs math theory, but I still learned a lot. Best JHU online class I've taken so far.

Most people do well in this class, but be prepared to follow his essay guidelines closely, or you won't get any grade higher than a B minus. Basically, stick close to the example essays he provides in class and you should do well. He does give a lot of help, and goes over your essays twice with you before having you submit a final draft.
No Comments

The worst class I have ever taken. The professor keeps making mistakes when giving lectures and the stuff he teaches is not enough to do the problem sets which is very hard and time-consuming. Also has unclear grading guidelines-- he told us that 90-100 is an A but he actually give A- for all grade under 95%. If you are not AMS major, avoid.
Yeapp
No Comments
He does a pretty good job of explaining the material. Some of his lectures are a bit boring. His tests are pretty fair.

Really hard material and he just assumes that everyone came into the course knowing rudimental chemistry so he doesn't explain things very much at all. He just reads straight off of the blackboard powerpoint. Tests are really hard, OWL problems take time but are easy. Surprisingly, he is a fair grader and my end grade was curved very generously

A boondoggle of a class. Sheer low hanging fruit. If it weren't for his interest in surface science and his love of fine wine I would have detested the course. A true Welsh character, through and through.
Not particularly good.
Extremely helpful. Teaches straight from the book so make sure you read before class. Do lots of problems. Tests are rather difficult.

His lectures are mandatory and you should not miss them. He engages with the class as best as he can. Yet, his test questions (hard)do not always reflect the lectures. You need to understand the concepts thoroughly and then be able to apply them to any question.VarietyofPractice problems are necessary. Helpful at office hours. Wants you to do well.
Geat professor. Clear, office hours are good.

I took two classes with Falk at Michigan. He's a great guy.  He really goes out of his way to engage students in creative ways. You can expect homework sets will be tough, but if you go to office hours he'll walk you through anything you're stuck on. He will probably assign a bunch of MATLAB simulations, and maybe a class multimedia project.

I took two classes with Falk at Michigan. He's a great guy.  He really goes out of his way to engage students in creative ways. You can expect homework sets will be tough, but if you go to office hours he'll walk you through anything you're stuck on. He will probably assign a bunch of MATLAB simulations, and maybe a class multimedia project.

Very bad lecturer. Better off getting explanations at his office hours. TAs won't help you. He offers a generous grade line and offers extra credit quizzes from time to time. The exams are really similar to the backtests so best bet is to study those first before exams.

While I think that Dr. Falzone has a very generous curve, I did not find his lectures helpful. The lectures were sometimes very hard to follow and he tends to go off topic and rush through the actual material. Be prepared to teach yourself using the textbook because Dr. Falzone tends to assume that you already know the information.

Going into Orgo as a freshman was terrifying, yet it's now my easiest class. Falzone's grading makes an 80 and A, and you'll likely do better than that. He drops 3/8 quizzes, replaces lowest midterm with final if that helps, gives extra credit and has tons of backtests. Your grade will be reflective of how well you understand orgo, with wiggle room

Took him for orgo I over the summer. Super fun guy and his lectures keep you engaged, but make sure to read the textbook for his exams and final. Honestly, he could keep up his happy quirkiness despite the class's dismal enthusiasm.
I had him for freshman ochem section. His tests are very doable and he gives you chances to improve your grade. Only annoying thing was his nearly weekly quizzes.

Falzone might not be the best lecturer, but his tests are FAIR. No unexpected twists or turns, if you read the textbook and work hard for class, you'll pass with an A! Your lowest midterm score is dropped, that made me go from a C to an A. Bless this man. He has a sense of humor and you really learn to love him.

Very personable guy and a good lecturer. He goes over everything you need to know - maybe not super clearly, but all slides are posted online. Office hours are great too, he really cares about the students and the class.
One of the best professors at Hopkins, really cares about his students.
Falzone teaches the freshman section of orgo. The tests were really fair and a majority of the class got an A. If you take this class, plan on doing PILOT too, since he collaborates with it.

Pretty friendly guy, but not a great lecturer. Especially when it comes to NMR- he speaks on a level that his students aren't yet equipped to understand. It's not hard to do well in the class if you work hard, however. His tests are consistent and he gives tons of practice. The course is pretty interesting too.
Great professor, always eager to answer students' questions. Occasionally cracks jokes. Interesting character.

First, Prof. Falzone is a great guy. He does want his students to be successful.  You only need to get an 80 to get an A. He doesn't  want hostile competition. Instead, he wants people to actually get the course material. However, on the other hand, he is not a clear lecturer. We had a substitute and most people think he is better at explaining.

He is a great lecturer and a great person in general.  He knows the material well and makes it very clear what you need to know.  He is also super accessible and if he knows you're genuinely trying, he will take a personal interest in your success.
Falzone is an amazing Professor who is ridiculously fair and an amazing lecturer, if you take orgo at hopkins, try to get him or Greenberg

Remember to write every reaction he puts on the board and understand them thoroughly. Office hours are essential. He notices when you try and will always be there for you.  Don't take too many courses along with this class. Scores around the high 70s to 80s are usually in the A range. Try your best and you'll reap the reward.

Organic chemistry is a tough concept, there's no getting around it. That being said, Falzone's class emphasizes independent studying. Pre-read the material before lecture, or be prepared to sit through class not knowing what's going on. Falzone assumes you've read.

He obviously knows the material very well and has a very good grasp on it, however, he is not as good in transferring this knowledge to his students clearly. I found practicing and studying myself much helpful than lectures. He's really helpful and Office hours are VERY helpful. He uses clickers so attending class gives you a few additional points.

Intelligent guy. Thinks deep. Exams can be tough, typical average is between 60-70. His office hours help a lot and he has plenty of respurces in his website. It can be quite intimidating to ask questions, but he's a really nice guy who sincerely cares for his students.

Falzone is definitely a very smart individual, but he's not the best teacher. He flies through chapters of the textbook within minutes, and goes through examples very quickly. In fact, if you don't read the textbook before class, odds are you'll be behind. He's not the best at office hours either, and can be very condescending. I don't recommend.
Don't take his class. he is not a good lecturer at all. he tries to be funny but he's not. Take Klein over the summer

She is a lovely person and the readings chosen were strong.  The material covered was important.  However, it was very difficult to determine what she was looking for, even when asking specific questions.  She seemed disorganized as a professor.  On another note, she is a great person to just chat with.

This was a required course in the online Ed.D. program at Johns Hopkins. This professor was completely disorganized, was rarely coherent, and for an online course, was virtually absent from all the discussions. Avoid at all costs!
Passionate about the subject, has guest lecturer, responds quickly to emails and grades quickly. Midterm and final were straightforward. What else could you want?
Passionate about the subject, has guest lecturer, responds quickly to emails and grades quickly. Midterm and final were straightforward. What else could you want?
great
she's hot, she's easy, great teacher
She is a lovely person and lecturer. I learned a lot from her class.
Dr. Feigenson is awesome!  And she's cute too.  So that's a plus.  She's really nice if you go talk to her in person.  Class was not that easy surprisingly though...Dont know what happened.

Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful. She is so so so helpful, treats you with so much respect and is clearly in love with her work. She's really inspiring, and so friendly to work with. She is really fair with her grading, and you get what you earned. Her class has made me decide on what I want to do for the rest of my life. A+
Great teacher - uses videos which are helpful and keep class interesting. Intro to Developmental Psych is much easier if you go to class.
Great class and excellent use of lectures
Great prof, great class!
The material itself if easy -- the questions on the midterms may seem quite confusing... (a fact true for most multiple-choice tests)...
No Comments

Ferrario is a great professor with a true, genuine passion for Islamic Studies. It is easy to access him outside of class to talk about a past lecture or upcoming assignment and his lectures coincide with the reading notes which makes it easy to catch-up if you miss a lecture (but watch our for the class participation grade)! 10/10 reccommend
really glad that taking course from him in bilkent
awesome guy and thoughtful
Amazing teacher. You can clearly see that he's very happy to be teaching the class and he wants the students to participate and talk with him. I'm glad that I took his class this semester.
Awesome teacher, very smart. Tough grader. Take his classes if you want a challenge

This was a difficult class. I am not a bad writer. Expository Writing: Freedom and the Self was not nearly so concerned with writing as it was with interpretation of texts. I realized the topic was vague, but I never expected to try so hard and be so consistently wrong. I had to drop after six weeks of hell. He's a good man teaching an awful topic.
Very clear lectures, but very harsh grading. Will give you a decent grade if you participate, but ultimately grades you on your ability to refute famous philosophers. Not an easy class.
Good guy, but a harsh grader.  Cool guy to hang out with, but avoid the class at all cost.

Professor Fessenbecker is an awesome professor except for that name wrecker.  He  requires two hours of meditating over a block of mozzarella every day. He also is a fan of challenging students to answering questions about the daily life of his cat Theodora.  Take his class at all cost.

Really just genuinely kind. Always letting us know she's there for us if we have questions. I had a family thing happen this semester and she was so understanding and thoughtful, unlike some of my other professors lol. I really enjoy reading now and I especially love writing.

Really just genuinely kind. Always letting us know she's there for us if we have questions. I had a family thing happen this semester and she was so understanding and thoughtful, unlike some of my other professors lol. I really enjoy reading now and I especially love writing.
Genuinely wants her students to do well and have meaningful, engaging discussions about the material. Great class!

Loved this class, the virtual live format allowed Chuck (and co-professor Pete Harmatuk) to make the class engaging. Really appreciated the ad libbed examples from his current and previous work experience. Very kind, flexible, and understanding. Great communicator and enthusiastic about the subject

Loved this class, the virtual live format allowed Chuck (and co-professor Pete Harmatuk) to make the class engaging. Really appreciated the ad libbed examples from his current and previous work experience. Very kind, flexible, and understanding. Great communicator and enthusiastic about the subject

Prof. Firestone is an amazing professor. He puts a lot of time and effort into making sure that learning in his class is both captivating and fun. His course webpage is nicely managed, and he adds a nice touch before every lecture with music. I am truly saddened that my intro psych journey has ended. It was a blast! I really recommend his class.
He is the best and he gives really informative and funny lectures that make information stick. Already want to take another class with him!
He is a real gem. Best professor ever!!!!

Chaz makes intro psych fun with his engaging lectures. Hes super approachable and puts a lot of effort into his class. Just be aware that, unlike the rest of the class, his tests are not all fun and games.
SO many profs here barely care about teaching. Firestone is the exception. He makes you love psychology as much as he does!! Just actually go to class and the exams aren't that hard

He skips so many major topics which you would expect to have in Psych101 but spends hours on insignificant and trivial details. He assigns a textbook which has nothing to do with the lectures or the exams (the exams require you to memorize every single sentence he's ever said). His showmanship might be fun, but it impairs his teaching abilities.

Prof. Firestone is an amazing professor. He puts a lot of time and effort into making sure that learning in his class is both captivating and fun. His course webpage is nicely managed, and he adds a nice touch before every lecture with music. I am truly saddened that my intro psych journey has ended. It was a blast! I really recommend his class.

Great prof, attendance is required to get a good grade. Slides posted don't have too much material. Exams are very different than other Hopkins exams, very memorization heavy, however, they aren't too difficult. Large percentage of the class ends with an A. Just an extremely fun class to take when you want to fill out your schedule.
Engaging professor. You'll do well if you attend class and listen.
Hi Chaz! Thanks for making me love psychology so much! Im really grateful I took your class first semester :)

Dr. Firestone is one of the best professors at Hopkins. If you have a chance to take one of his classes, do it - you won't regret it. He cares about his students and does everything he can to make everything fun and the grading fair.

The tests were at times really unclear and took the fun out of the class. His lectures are some of the best I have seen though, but his slides are not really helpful for reviewing material outside of class because there is not much text. Be cautious.
Fun. Funny. Interesting. Easy.
Best professor I have ever had.

The only professor who made me feel legitimately sad when a class ended. Suffice to say the second another class shows up being taught by Chaz, I will be the first to register (or first on the waitlist when SIS crashes again).

Chaz was easily the best lecturer/teacher I've ever had and probably will have. It didn't feel like I was sitting in a 450 person class. He puts so much work into the material and cares that his students learn and appreciate it. He even takes the time to answer questions! I looked forward to going to class every day, ily Chaz.
Great professor
Amazing professor. Easily the best professor I've had at Hopkins. He puts in so much effort and is extremely passionate. Highly suggest taking his class.
Incredible teacher.
Amazing class that always has engaging lectures taught by a phenomenal guy.
Cannot say enough good things about this man. Ask him to show you grappling.

The class is really long since it's only once a week so the interesting lectures kind of drone on but the professor cares so much about all of his students doing well and learning. His exams are straightforward and he gives study guides. You have to put in work but you can always get the results you studied for. Amazing class and amazing guy.
Dedicated Professor. Had what I want in a professor: care, about subject matter and students.  Nice guy, good teacher.
Great teacher. Keeps the material interesting. Always available to help. Overall, just a great guy!
BEST BIO TEACHER AT HOPKINS! Dr Fisher needs to teach more classes, I would go join every one. She uses simple English and easy analogies, and is a very inclusive lecturer which I appreciate.
BEST BIO TEACHER AT HOPKINS! Dr Fisher needs to teach more classes, I would go join every one. She uses simple English and easy analogies, and is a very inclusive lecturer which I appreciate.

Dr. Fisher is a very clear and passionate lecturer who comes up with creative ideas to help you learn the material in class. She is very down to earth and fun to talk to, and is always willing to help you study in new ways or understand course material. I wish she taught more classes!
She's a great professor.  Really clear in her lectures and easy to approach.  Best biochem professor yet.

Dr. Fisher is very thorough in her lectures, and makes sure that her students understand what she's talking about. She's also incredibly approachable, has an amazing sense of humor, and is willing to see students outside of class for extra help and questions.
Had her for Biochem and Cell Bio. She is one of the best bio teachers at Hopkins. Very nice and helpful. Easily approachable and fun to learn from and look at.
I agree with the above rating. Wonderful professor, but the exams weren't extremely clear sometimes making them even more difficult.
Extremely helpful, truly cares about students. Holds recitations everyday, friendly, lectures are clear. Exams are very difficult though and unclear.

I had Fishkind for Opti I and he is a great lecturer who frequently pauses for questions. His tests are EXTREMELY fair (everything on the tests has either been done explicitly in lecture or are on a backtest). Good course and, with a little effort, it's an easy A for a math class.

Prof. Fishkind is a great lecturer; however, he lectures INCREDIBLY fast. This may not seem so terrible, but I should mention that his lecture notes are critical to your success in the course. That said, as a seasoned student may be aware, it is very difficult to take quality notes at a rapid pace while concurrently giving him your full attention.

His lectures were amazing, and he is great in explaining very unintuitive abstract concepts in a very simple way, making it easy to visualize things. His expertise in multiple branches of Maths also makes him give extraordinary intuition on looking at a same theorem on Matrix from various perspectives, like Graph theoretical, probabilistic etc.
terrible professor who does not care at all about his students
Great guy, terrible professor. His exams are based on regurgitating lecture notes. Is this even a math class?

Great lecturer and hilarious dude, however the course grade depends entirely on your ability to regurgitate proofs on three exams. I failed the first midterm because I studied the textbook rather than my class notes, so be aware of this if you're taking Crypto with Fishkind! Other than that he's a great professor who's passionate about the subject.
Dr. Fishkind is one of the best lecturers I have ever had. He is very clear and helpful.

Really good teacher. Gives interesting examples in class applicable to the sciences and engineering and great notes. Clearly states expectations for the exams. Even though some questions on the exam are theoretical but all the proofs are in his notes.

Lectures quickly...do not attempt to listen and understand...just take notes and review them  Approachable BUT not accessable.  Absent entire week of Passover however felt it was fine to "substitute" office hours prior to exam on Easter Sunday at 10am as only "makeup" time available!
Great professor. Goes through material and takes questions during lecture. Provides everything you need to succeed in class. I didn't even buy the textbook. Take this class.
Professor Fishkind is by far one of the best professors I have ever met in the world of higher education.  Not only is he one of the smartest people I have met he is a good person and he is HOT!!!
had him for prob and stat. easies t class ever. very approachable and very helpful. his math jokes are actually funny. take this class if you want perfect test scores.
funny and lively. go to class, do the hw and you will do well
He is a good teacher and does not mind giving extra help if needed
the only stats teacher I've ever had who was interesting or lively.  Great professor.

This guy is a ****ing idiot. He spends an hour rambling about some theorem that we will never see on the test, or ever again in the real world, and neglects the material for the test. If you have this guy, prepare to learn entirely from your TA and the book, they are your only resources in this class.
Very helpful, lectures so well all you really need to do is attend class.  Even though the class required you do the work, if you did that basically meant a good grade.
Tough material presented about as well as it could be.  Very difficult class.  Didn't need the billy joel knockoff song though.
Cool guy.  He's fair and considerate and, at least for me, made an unbearably boring subject almost interesting.  I was impressed.  He also displays a pretty good sense of humor when he wants to.
This professor is really nice and likes to make jokes, but statistics sucks all the same and there are always a few "surprise" questions on the exams you couldn't have seen coming.

I love her. PEBL has been such an amazing and valuable experience and I strongly recommend it to freshmen, although it does take some time to finish all the work. Dr. Fitch is the best prof I've ever had at Hopkins, very caring and passionate and she has been so helpful both in and out of class. She cares about her class and her students a lot!

I love her. PEBL has been such an amazing and valuable experience and I strongly recommend it to freshmen, although it does take some time to finish all the work. Dr. Fitch is the best prof I've ever had at Hopkins, very caring and passionate and she has been so helpful both in and out of class. She cares about her class and her students a lot!

My absolute favorite professor at Hopkins, hands down. She cares about her students and wants to see them succeed. Class is relatively simple and does require a time commit. I learned so much and my friends agree that PEBL was the most beneficial lab at Hopkins. Would take another class with her in a heart beat! I miss her!
